pullRequest.title: Refactored FT 1.0 Bulkhead Tests with CountDownLatch
pullRequest.bodyText:
Refactored BulkheadTest.java methods, testAsyncBulkhead and testAsyncBulkheadQueueFull
to utilize CountDownLatch objects. These ensure that tasks within this test
do not always take 10000ms to run in the case of early completion,
or that tests exceed 10000ms in the case of interrupted execution.
AsyncTestFunction.java was also refactored with a new constructor to
enable the creation of an AsyncTestFunction with three CountDownLatch
objects. This enables the new behaviour added to BulkheadTest.java.

nodes.bodyText:
This assertion doesn't actually do anything. Since we're catching BulkheadException, it's guaranteed that e is an instance of BulkheadException.
There's a similar assertion in the 2.0 test which does do an important check, because there we're catching ExecutionException and checking the type of its cause.
It's not a big problem and if it was the only comment I wouldn't worry about it, but in general, I would try to avoid code which looks like it does something important that it doesn't actually do.
